Macrobius Saturnalia: In the 4th Book of his treatise On the Gods Apollodorus gives the sun the epithet ῖήϊος, declaring that Apollo is so called because he moves (ἵεσθαι) or goes (ἰέναι) through the universe even as the sun careers through the sky. This, however, is what we find in Timotheus:

Come, Sun, thou hurler of bright rays at the everlasting skyey vault, send from thy bowstring afar-flung shaft upon our enemies, O Healer to whom we cry!1
